page.title: 06DEFYNNOG & THE NATIONAL PARK
page.content: Defynnog is in the National Park. A National Park is an area of untamed beauty. In the National Park you will see mountain ponies, badgers, rabbits, buzzards, moles, mice, hawks, kites and lots lots more! There are farms in the National Park as well and they have more animals. Some farmers also grow crops of barley & oats. Within the Park there are three main mountain ranges. The most famous range is the Brecon Beacons; Defynnog lies between these & Fforest Fawr (another range). A Field centre has been set up quite close to Defynnog. Many tourists & locals visit this. The fences and stone walls are the farmers property but you can walk through them by using public footpaths & gates & stiles. The National Park is bounded by Ammanford, Abergavenny, Merthyr, Hay and Brecon. (Merrissa Fallas) (See photo 1)
